document_data.name: Serpé
document_data.Description: Tan-skinned and with shoulder-length dark hair, Serpé dressed in a low-cut white blouse and dark pants, fastened with a metallic belt. She carried several items of jewelry, including earrings and numerous necklaces. She wore an eyepatch over her left eye.
document_data.Personality: She sought out dangerous adventures specifically, since those made for the best stories afterwards.
document_data.Possessions:
Serpé owned a ''[[belt of swimming]]'', which allowed her to swim as fast as a [[triton]] underwater, and as fast as a [[merfolk|merman]] above the surface. The belt was also enchanted to have the properties of a ''[[ring of warmth]]'', giving Serpé the ability to swim without concern even in freezing waters. Upon exiting the water, her ''belt of swimming'' instantly dried both her hair and her clothes.{{Cite card/AD&D Trading Cards/1993|461|Serpé's Belt of Swimming}}

She also owned a pair of ''[[gauntlets of dexterity]]'', and an enchanted [[cutlass]].
document_data.Activities: Serpé was constantly on the move, looking for new adventures. She was willing to join any adventuring party, so long as their business was both heroic and particularly daring.
